specificInfo: Aciclovir is excreted into breast milk in small amounts; unlikely to be harmful in usual doses.
Use with caution in hepatic impairment.
Considered safe to use during pregnancy; extensive data have not shown an increased risk of malformations or other harmful effects.

renalImpairment.specificInfo: Reduce dose in moderate to severe renal impairment to avoid accumulation and neurotoxicity.

sideEffects.specificInfo: Common: Vomiting; Eye pain; Photosensitivity reaction; Fever; Skin reactions; Abdominal pain; Diarrhoea; Nausea; Fatigue; Headache; Eye inflammation. Uncommon: Anaemia; Skin reactions. Rare: Acute renal failure; Drowsiness; hallucinations; tremor; agitation; encephalopathy. Frequency not known: Crystalluria

dosages.doseInfo: Apply a 1 cm ribbon of ointment five times daily into the lower conjunctival sac
